LuaScript:
--[[
    Nothing to see here, cowboy.

    All the shitty code you're looking for is inside the Tile object
]]

ObjectStates.Name: Custom_Tile
ObjectStates.LuaScript:
--[[
    *** GIT GUID Tool by Felixinius *** (Can't believe i'm authoring this thing)

    * This tool gets the GUIDs of all elements spawned and arrange them in a somewhat
        neat way on a notebook tab where you can readily use as table / array for your script.

    * THIS MIGHT CRASH YOUR GAME IF THERE ARE A LOT OF SPAWNED OBJECTS. WATCH OUT!

    * Yes that's all there's to it. Don't worry, it won't touch your favorite very serious D&D
        campaign instructions.

    * I advise to properly name every single object in the table to avoid
        weird naming like "3DText_123456790" in the results.

    * I'm very new at lua so if you find a bug, don't be surprised
        and please report the steps necessary to recreate it on the comments page
        so i can take a look at it and see if i manage to fix.

    * The reason i even spent my time with this thing is because i learn a new language
        easier through actual practicing with stupid crap like this instead of reading a
        1000 pages book / documentation.

    * The "Git GUID" idea came from when i was showing a friend how modding on TTS worked
        and the asshole insisted on me uploading this tool to the Workshop because why not.

    * I cleaned, documented and organized my code to the best of my actual knowledge
        but it might still be a mess for most people.

    * LEL DURK SOOLS JOKES X--DDDD GEET GOOD

    * I apologize if there's a tool just like mine (or better) already, i didn't really search up on this.
        Link it to me in the comments, though.

]]

vesselTabs = {}
vesselCount = 1

function onLoad()
    self.createButton({
        click_function = "luaSouls",
        function_owner = self,
        label = "Git\nGuid",
        position = {0.64, 0.2, 0.46},
        width = 350,
        height = 350,
        font_size = 120,
        tooltip = "It's just like Dark Souls!",
        alignment = 3,
        -- I know these are not necessary but what if Knil decides all of sudden 
        -- defaults are yellow font with pink polka dots background just for april fools or something?
        color = {1,1,1},
        font_color = {0,0,0}
    })
end

function luaSouls()
    -- To avoid spammy assholes
        if #vesselTabs >= 4 then
            broadcastToAll("ENOUGH! There are 4 Notebook Tabs already!", {1,0,0})
            return false
        end

    -- Get all the crap
    local souls = getAllObjects()

    -- Our vessel is empty, waiting for those precious souls...
    local vessel = {}

    -- If you happen to have a bunch of objects with the same name, this
    -- makes sure it'll register all of them without replacing one another.
    local NameCounter = 1

    -- For use along NameCounter. If we're on a new tag, then resets.
    local lastTag = ''

    -- Yeah i decided to create a loop because this way i can easily organize
    -- stuff by their "tag" type. (Dice, Deck, Card, Tile, Poop, etc)
    for i,soul in ipairs(souls) do
        -- For some reason "soul.name" only returns the object name
        -- even if it has a nickname on it, so my solution was this:
        soulName = tostring(soul.getName())
        if soul.getName() == '' then soulName = soul.name end

        -- I hope there's a better way to do this.
        if vessel[soul.tag] == nil then
            vessel[soul.tag] = {}
        end

        -- I mean, it just feels ugly
        if lastTag ~= soul.tag then NameCounter = 1 end

        if vessel[soul.tag][soulName] ~= nil then
            soulName = soulName .. "_" .. tostring(NameCounter)
            NameCounter = NameCounter + 1
        end
        vessel[soul.tag][soulName] = soul.guid
        lastTag = soul.tag
    end
    
    -- This is where i add the Notebook Tab
    local vessel_id = addNotebookTab({
        title = "Captured Souls " .. vesselCount,
        body = unbox_vessel(vessel)
    })
    broadcastToAll("Vessel created on Notebook. Take care of those souls...",{1,1,1})
    RemoveVesselsButton()

    -- Silly lua doesn't have compound assignment operators, shame on you.
    vesselCount = vesselCount + 1

    -- Adding the Tab id for later so i can delete them without touching your other stuff
    table.insert(vesselTabs,vessel_id)

    return true
end

-- I basically use this to transform the table into a text form
-- If you know a better way to do this, PLEASE tell me
-- so the ghost of Dennis Ritchie will stop haunting my bedroom due to bad coding
function unbox_vessel(boxedvessel)
    local list = "GUIDS = {\n"
    local i = ''
    local subsoul = ''
    -- "\t" doesn't seem to work here for some reason, hell if i know.
    local tab = "    "
    for soultype,subsoul in pairs(boxedvessel) do
        list = list .. tab .. soultype .. " = {\n"

        for subSoulName, subSoulGUID in pairs(subsoul) do
            list = list .. tab .. tab .. subSoulName .. " = '" .. subSoulGUID .. "'"
            -- Add commas only if not last one
            if next(subsoul,subSoulName) ~= nil  then
                list = list .. ','
            end
            list = list .. "\n"
        end

        list = list .. tab .. "}"
        -- Same as i did above
        if next(boxedvessel,soultype) ~= nil  then
            list = list .. ','
        end
        list = list .. "\n"
    end
    list = list .. "}"
    return list

end


-- Remove button because i'm pretty sure your funny friend will click this a bunch of times.
RemoveButtonExists = false

function RemoveVesselsButton()
    if RemoveButtonExists == true then 
        return false 
    else
        self.createButton({
            click_function = "FreeSouls",
            function_owner = self,
            label = "Free\nSouls",
            position = {0.9, 0.2, -0.66},
            width = 300,
            height = 300,
            font_size = 90,
            tooltip = "Remove all Notebook tabs this tool created",
            alignment = 3,
            color = {0,0,0.5},
            font_color = {1,1,1}
        })
        RemoveButtonExists = true
        return true
    end
end

function FreeSouls()
    for i,vesselID in pairs(vesselTabs) do
        -- KNOWN BUG: For some reason it's not removing every tab even though they are there
        removeNotebookTab(vesselID)
    end
    
    -- KNIL PLEASE make createButton() return the button index so i don't have to do this
    for i,button in pairs(self.getButtons()) do
        if button.label  == "Free\nSouls" then
            self.removeButton(button.index)
            RemoveButtonExists = false
            vesselTabs = {}
            broadcastToAll("The souls were freed again!",{0,1,0})
            break
        end
    end
end

How to use:
1) Right click the tool;

3) Spawn it whenever
you need it.

These objects are
only here to
demonstrate the
functionality
